page.title: 02Leckford Estate
page.content: The{John Lewis Partnership}has owned most of Leckford since 1928.The church is the only building in Leckford that is not owned by the partnership.{138 people}live in the parish,in the{55 houses and cottages owned by the group. The John Lewis Partnership own{4000 {acres, }of which 2000 are in Leckford,and the rest in Longstock and Stockbridge.In it is Riches Wood that was mentioned in the first Domesday Book. To administer the estate there is {one office}with 2 secretaries,2 clerks and 1 accountant.They have a computer to help them. 5 people are employed in the {maintainance}department.They thatch roofs and paint and repair buildings.
